reviewText: This is a kind of buy you do because you are a fan of Metallica early years (e.g. before the black album). None of the video besides one are related to this era (because they did not do video until One), but as a faithful fan you go for it.there is nothing magic and the video are in the old 4:3 format, but yes you can watch One and few other good songs the band released during the downward music spiral...

reviewText: This has everything except the Cliff'em all footage, but that wasn't really a music video, so it's ok. The first few videos like One and Enter Sandman are very good, then... you can see the decline as they get into the Load/Re-Load stuff. Some of those videos are just plain weird. Cliff must have been puking in his grave. If nothing else, it's a good documentary of how a band can fall from greatness. We still have to see if they can get back up on top, or if they turn into another geezer band that just won't go away. How long has it been since they put out any really good, original heavy metal? About 16 years? Here's hoping their next studio album blows away Master of Puppets. (yeah, right..)

Title: N/A

reviewText: Metallica my favorite band so I have to be honest with myself and for the fans out their of there's.  The total number of video's are 23 but their are two versions of one, and the Unforgiven.  You have the about 7 and half minute one, and the short version video which is with the intro about 11 minutes making the video only about 5 minutes give or take for the other one video.  The Unforgiven is about 6 and half regular cut, the full length video is 11 minutes.  I ended up not liking 4 video's of the DVD collection.  They were until it sleeps, Mama said, Whiskey in the Jar, and One Jammin version.  But if someone was to ask my favorite videos of my favorite band it would have to be, One because of the story it tells about the solider and the injuries he recieves in war, Wherever I may Roam I like this video because of the shots of them on the road and all the fans going wild, King Nothing I enjoyed because of the location look like Russia, No Leaf Clover because of the shots with the SFO, St. Anger for it's location being filmed, and last two Noting Else Matters and Some Kind of Monster because it looks at the band in the studio and what they are going threw to keep the band going shows the fire they have to keep their music going no matter what.  I eneded up seeing for first time 11 videos of Metallica's that I never saw before I bought this DVD collection. So if your a true fan buy this video collection and see how many of their video's you end up enjoying as much as I have over the years since I bought it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In addition to every video they've ever made, for the first time ever the "2 of One," release (which up until now has only been available on VHS) will be available on DVD. All the audio has been re-mixed in 5.1 surround sound.Here is the track listing:One 7:41Enter Sandman 5:28The Unforgiven 6:21Nothing Else Matters 6:24Wherever I May Roam 6:05Sad But True 5:26Until It Sleeps 4:32Hero Of The Day 4:30Mama Said 4:51 (never aired in North America)King Nothing 5:26The Memory Remains 4:37The Unforgiven II 6:33Fuel 4:35Turn The Page 5:49Whiskey In The Jar 4:43No Leaf Clover 5:33I Disappear 4:28St. Anger 5:50Frantic 4:55The Unnamed Feeling 5:29Some Kind Of Monster 4:28Bonus2 Of One - Introduction 5:43One (Jammin' Version) 5:05The Unforgiven (Theatrical Version) 11:29Metallica: Some Kind Of Monster Film Trailer 2:27

reviewText: I dont know why all the bad reviews.  Yes I am aware that metallica has sold out and blah blah blah, but this video collection is still a blessing!  Every music video by metallica is on here.  Its a great buy.  21 videos, plus 2 bonus videos, an introduction to one music video and a theatrical trailer for the film some kind of monster.  Even the saint anger videos were good.  I had never seen those videos before.  I have seen every other metallica video on mtv, but never saw anything from st anger.  I guess due to the fact that I didnt like any of the saint anger songs.  Saint anger the song isnt too great, but the video alone makes the song enjoyable.  All in all I have been waitng for a video collection since I was about 16.  But I am actually glad they waited to get all the vids from st anger.  Like I said the videos are actually cool. and make the songs better.  It has All the videos from And justice for all album to the st anger album and even the some kind of monster single or whatever it  was.  They didnt make any music videos before this so you wont find anything from ride the lightning or puppets.  Dvd for songs from those times can be found on cliff em all and it is all live bootleg footage.  So no more complaints about this dvd not having anything before justice please!  If you dont know that they had no videos before that album, then you shouldnt even give a review.  And to the people who say metallica sucks now so blah.  Well while metallica is more of a band of the past to me now more than anything, I still enjoyed every single one of these videos.  I dont care how many times they have "sold out" the music is still good and the videos havent changed since the day they aired.  Which brings me to my one and only complaint.  The turn the page video is still censored!  I mean they could have at least given us both versions.  Ginger lynn was a porn star, so its not like she cares if anyone sees her naked body.  I think it should have at least been an extra.  Other than that, its perfect, simple and just the way I always wanted it to be!

reviewText: This is a great put together DVD package that shows the growth and (sometimes not good) changes of Metallica's Style and Music.  The only annoying flaw (like the POSION video DVD) is the audio isn't very insync with the video=where James is singing and his vocals aren't matching up exactly with the footage.  I don't understand why this happens with so many music dvds=is it that hard for the production dept. to get something like this right?Anyways, it's great to have all the Metallica videos all together to watch and relive the memories of good (and bad) Metallica=Since MTV doesn't even show music videos (well, there's always FUSE!)I will say though if you want ONE Metallica DVD then pick up CLIFF 'EM ALL which is old school Metallica and is filled with raw, vintage music and footage of what Metallica's REALLY with all about.
summary: Complete collection of Videos /But production is flawed.
